oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use of wetlands, ponds and buffer zones in Finland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Koskiaho, Jari
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Main purpose of the CWs (constructed wetlands) for the treatment of runoff from agricultural areas is to reduce nutrient loading to surface waters and hence combat eutrophication. The most important single design parameter controlling retention effectiviness of a CW is its area in relation to the catchment area. Input concentrations, catchment properties(soil type!), hydraulic efficiency and CW soil properties also have a significant influence on the effectiviness.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Koskiaho, Jari (2005) Use of wetlands, ponds and buffer zones in Finland. In: Proceedings from NJF seminar no. 374, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, pp. 70-72.
